title: **Setup to be performed at least 6 hours prior to starting manipulations**

body.body: Equilibrate 5ml G-TL and 5ml Embryo Biopsy Medium in 5ml tubes at 37°C, 6% CO2 and 5% O2.
Equilibrate two 4ml aliquots of Ovoil at 37°C, 6% CO2 and 5% O2 in 5ml tubes.

Setup G-TL culture dishes for post manipulation zygotes.  Make two 100µl drops of G-TL in a centre-well dish and overlay with 1.5ml Ovoil.  For traceability the embryos are cultured individually post manipulation.  The number of dishes required is dependent upon the number of zygotes to be manipulated.

Setup a G-TL wash dish for the washing of the manipulated zygotes prior to transfer to the post manipulation dish for overnight culture.  Add 0.5ml G-TL to a centre well dish and cover with 1.5ml Ovoil.
Conduct all zygote manipulations in an environmentally controlled isolator set at 37°C, 6% CO2 and 5% O2.
Switch on the heated stage of the Integra Ti micromanipulator to 37°C.
Set up the Integra Ti micromanipulator system with the holding and biopsy pipettes as per manufacturer’s instructions.
Calibrate the laser according to manufacturer’s instructions.

title: **Dish setup just prior to starting manipulations**

body.body: A manipulation pipette immersion dish is setup to keep the holding and biopsy pipettes immersed in medium between manipulations to prevent blockage.  Add five 5µl drops of equilibrated G-TL into an ICSI dish and pour over equilibrated Ovoil.

body: Setup the PNT manipulation ICSI dish with

body.title: i)
body.body: two 5µl drops of equilibrated Embryo Biopsy Medium containing 10µg/ml Nocodazole and 2.5µm Latrunculin A, ii) one 2µl drop of HVJ-E, iii) cover with equilibrated Ovoil.
Use the manipulation pipette immersion dish to prime the holding and biopsy pipettes.
Transfer the two zygotes to be manipulated into separate drops of Nocodazole/Latrunculin A containing medium.
Replace the pipette immersion dish with the manipulation dish.
Position the first zygote so that both pronuclei are in focus and the polar bodies are distant from the site where the biopsy pipette will be introduced.
Immobilise the zygote by gentle suction with the holding pipette.
Select the laser objective and ensure the pronuclei are in focus.

Using the 6.7µm, 0.251ms, 400mw setting  for the Saturn laser create an opening in the zona pellucida by making a series of holes in a line from the inside of the zona and moving outwards.  This reduces the risk of damaging the zygote if cytoplasm leakage occurs once the zona is breached.
Ensure the first pronucleus to be removed and the biopsy pipette are in focus.
Insert the biopsy pipette into the embryo and position the pipette so that there is minimal cytoplasm between the pronucleus and the opening of the biopsy pipette.
Gently aspirate the first pronucleus into the biopsy pipette.  Continue to aspirate but start to remove the biopsy pipette once the pronucleus has entered the pipette.
Pulling the biopsy pipette away from the zygote will separate the first karyoplast.
Expel the karyoplast out of the pipette.
Repeat the process from step 9 to 12 in order to remove the second pronucleus.
Release the zygote from the holding pipette
Repeat steps 4 to 14 with the second zygote.
Aspirate the karyoplasts from the second zygote into the biopsy pipette.
Lift the holding pipette out of the dish.
Move the biopsy pipette to the drop of HVJ-E.

Gently start to expel the karyoplasts but stop expelling when a karyoplast reaches the opening of the pipette.  Gently aspirate a minimal amount of the HVJ-E to ensure the karyoplast is just inside the pipette.  Note: Only the karyoplast closest to the opening of the biopsy pipette is exposed to the HVJ-E drop.
Move the biopsy pipette to the drop with the first enucleated zygote.
Position the enucleated zygote with the hole in the zona at the 3 o’clock position.
Immobilise the zygote by gentle suction with the holding pipette.
Insert the pipette to ensure good contact with the cytoplast.
Expel the karyoplasts slowly at the same time as gently removing the pipette.
Excess cytoplasm can be pinched off by squeezing any excess cytoplasm between the biopsy pipette and zona pellucida.
Aspirate the karyoplasts from the first zygote into the biopsy pipette.
Repeat steps 17 to 25 but at step 20 move to the drop with the second enucleated zygote.
Replace the manipulation dish with the pipette immersion dish if there are more manipulations to be performed.
Transfer one of the reconstituted zygotes to the G-TL wash dish.  Wash gently around the drop.
Transfer to a G-TL culture dish for post manipulation zygotes.  Clearly label with embryo details.

Culture the zygotes at 37°C, 6% CO2 and 5% O2 in the isolator-based workstation incubator.
